name: Pork Tenderloin with Dijon Marsala Sauce
author: KOALAGIRL
summary: Pork tenderloin coated in Dijon mustard, and served with a Marsala mustard sauce.  Absolutely delicious!  Try the sauce over other cuts of meat and vegetables.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Coat pork tenderloins generously with mustard
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Arrange tenderloins in pan, and brown the meat
Transfer meat to prepared baking dish
Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes
Turn, and continue cooking for 20 minutes, or until desired doneness
Meanwhile, melt butter over medium heat in the same pan used to cook the pork
Cook shallots in butter until soft
Stir in Marsala, mustard, and cream, and cook until volume of liquid is reduced by half
Slice pork, and place on a serving dish
Spoon sauce over meat, and serve
